sen.j: 江木欣々（えぎ きんきん、1877年（明治10年）1月30日 - 1930年（昭和5年）2月20日）は、明治期の法律学者江木衷（まこと・ちゅう）の妻。
sen.e: Kinkin EGI (January 30, 1877 - February 20, 1930) was a wife of Makoto (his name can also be pronounced Chu) EGI who was a law scholar in the Meiji period.
Kinkin EGI (January 30, 1877 - February 20, 1930) was a wife of Makoto (his name can also be pronounced Chu) EGI who was a law scholar in the Meiji period.
Kinkin EGI (January 30, 1877 - February 20, 1930) was a wife of Makoto (his name can also be pronounced Chu) EGI who was a law scholar in the Meiji period.
Her real name was Eiko.
Her real name was Eiko.
Her real name was Eiko.

sen.j: 号を欣々、または欣々栄と称した。
sen.e: She gave herself the second name of Kinkin or Kinkinei (欣々栄).
She gave herself the second name of Kinkin or Kinkinei (欣々栄).
She gave herself the second name of Kinkin or Kinkinei (欣々栄).

sen.j: 生年は明治12年（1879年）説がある。
sen.e: It is said that the year of birth was 1879.
It is also said that the year of birth was 1879.
It is also said that the year of birth was 1879.

sen.j: 異父弟にシャープ創業者の早川徳次 (シャープ)がいる。
sen.e: Tokuji HAYAKAWA, the founder of SHARP Corporation was her younger maternal half-brother.
Tokuji HAYAKAWA, the founder of SHARP Corporation was her younger maternal half-brother.
Tokuji HAYAKAWA, the founder of SHARP Corporation was her younger maternal half-brother.

sen.j: 九条武子、柳原白蓮と並んで大正三美人と称された。
sen.e: She was referred to as one of the three beautiful women of the Taisho period, along with Takeko KUJO and Byakuren YANAGIHARA.
She was referred to as one of the three beautiful women of the Taisho period, along with Takeko KUJO and Byakuren YANAGIHARA.
She was referred to as one of the three beautiful women of the Taisho period, along with Takeko KUJO and Byakuren YANAGIHARA.

sen.j: 愛媛県令だった関新平が女中の藤谷花子に手を付け栄子が生れた。
sen.e: Eiko was born to Shinpei SEKI, the Ehime prefectural governor who had an intimate relationship with his maid, Hanako FUJITANI.
sen.cmt: 関新平：せきしんぺい<http://kotobank.jp/word/%E9%96%A2%E6%96%B0%E5%B9%B3>藤谷花子の読み不明
sen.e: Eiko was born to Shinpei SEKI, the Ehime prefectural governor who had an intimate relationship with his maid, Hanako FUJITANI.
Eiko was born to Shinpei SEKI, the Ehime prefectural governor who had an intimate relationship with his maid, Hanako FUJITANI.

sen.j: 栄子は養女に出されたが、養家が困窮したため、神田明神下の講武所の花街で舞妓となった。
sen.e: Eiko was adopted and then became a maiko (apprentice geisha) in a hanamachi (geisha district) around Kobusho (military training institute) in the Kanda Myojin Shita because her adoptive family became badly off.

Eiko was adopted out and then became a maiko (apprentice geisha) in a hanamachi (geisha district) around Kobusho (military training institute) near Kanda Myojin-Shrine because her adoptive family became badly off.
sen.cmt: adoped out を使いました。near Kanda Myojin-Shrineに訂正しました。
sen.e: Eiko was adopted out and then became a maiko (apprentice geisha) in a hanamachi (geisha district) around Kobusho (military training institute) near Kanda Myojin-Shrine because her adoptive family became badly off.

sen.j: 栄子は16歳で九州の細川氏の家老職、有吉男に落籍され正妻となった。
sen.e: At the age of 16, Eiko became a legal wife of a son of Ariyoshi, Karo (chief retainer) of the Hosokawa clan in the Kyushu region after he bought her contractual freedom.
At the age of 16, Eiko became a legal wife of a son of Ariyoshi, Karo (chief retainer) of the Hosokawa clan in the Kyushu region after he bought her contractual freedom.
At the age of 16, Eiko became a legal wife of a son of Ariyoshi, Karo (chief retainer) of the Hosokawa clan in the Kyushu region after he bought her contractual freedom.

sen.j: しかし夫は1年あまりで病没。
sen.e: However, her husband died of illness just a year later.
However, her husband died of illness just a year later.
However, her husband died of illness just a year later.

sen.j: 栄子は有吉家を出されて再び花柳界に戻った。
sen.e: She was dismissed from the Ariyoshi family and then came back to the Karyukai (world of the geisha).
She was dismissed from the Ariyoshi family and then came back to the Karyukai (world of the geisha).
She was dismissed from the Ariyoshi family and then came back to the Karyukai (world of the geisha).

sen.j: 今度は新橋に移り、松屋から「ぼたん」という名でふたたび半玉として出ることになった。
sen.e: She moved to Shinbashi this time and served again in Matsuya as a hangyoku (child geisha) under the name of 'Botan (tree peony).'
She moved to Shinbashi this time and served again in Matsuya as a hangyoku (child geisha) under the name of 'Botan (tree peony).'
She moved to Shinbashi this time and served again in Matsuya as a hangyoku (child geisha) under the name of 'Botan (tree peony).'

sen.j: 栄子は新橋の美貌芸者として名をはせ、間もなく江木衷と結婚した。
sen.e: Eiko gained a reputation as a beautiful geisha in Shinbashi and then got married to Makoto EGI.
Eiko gained a reputation as a beautiful geisha in Shinbashi and then got married to Makoto EGI.
Eiko gained a reputation as a beautiful geisha in Shinbashi and then got married to Makoto EGI.

sen.j: 自宅で関係者を集めてパーティを開き、そこが自ずから社交場となった。
sen.e: Inviting persons involved to her home, she threw parties, which functioned as a place for social interaction.
Inviting persons involved to her home, she threw parties, which functioned as a place for social interaction.
Inviting persons involved to her home, she threw parties, which functioned as a place for social interaction.

sen.j: 栄子は詩、書、画、篆刻、謡曲と広い趣味と才人ぶりを見せて花形となった。
sen.e: Eiko became a star, showing her wide-ranging hobbies of and talent in poetry, calligraphy, tenkoku (seal-engraving) and yokyoku (Noh song).
Eiko became a star, showing her wide-ranging hobbies of and talent in poetry, calligraphy, tenkoku (seal-engraving) and yokyoku (Noh song).
Eiko became a star, showing her wide-ranging hobbies of and talent in poetry, calligraphy, tenkoku (seal-engraving) and yokyoku (Noh song).
She lost her husband in 1925.
She lost her husband in 1925.
She lost her husband in 1925.

sen.j: 1930年、大阪の早川徳次の家で首吊り自殺した。
sen.e: In 1930, she killed herself by hanging in Tokuji HAYAKAWA's home in Osaka.
In 1930, she killed herself by hanging in Tokuji HAYAKAWA's home in Osaka.
In 1930, she killed herself by hanging in Tokuji HAYAKAWA's home in Osaka.

sen.j: 美人画家の鏑木清方の傑作「築地明石町」のモデルとして知られる（実はモデルは栄子の異母妹のませ子ともいわれる）。
sen.e: She was known as a model of "Tsukiji Akashi Cho", the masterpiece by Kiyokata KABURAGI, a painter of Bijinga ("Beautiful Woman Picture") (but it is said that the model was Maseko, her younger paternal half-sister).
sen.cmt: 築地明石町のスペルｊ<http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110000545922>を参照
sen.e: She is known as a model of 'Tsukiji Akashi Cho,' the masterpiece by Kiyokata KABURAGI, a painter of Bijinga ("Beautiful Woman Picture") (but it is also said that the model was Maseko, her younger paternal half-sister).
sen.cmt: was ⇒ is に訂正しました。" " ⇒ ' ' に訂正しました。also を追加しました。
sen.e: She is known as a model of 'Tsukiji Akashi Cho,' the masterpiece by Kiyokata KABURAGI, a painter of Bijinga ("Beautiful Woman Picture") (but it is also said that the model was Maseko, her younger paternal half-sister).
